Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which Donald Trump will not be profiting from the G-7 summit at his Doral resort. The expert's verdict mentions that Trump's trips to his resorts have raised questions about potential improper enrichment or violation of the emoluments clause.
Lack enough support: The expert's verdict mentions that the White House and Trump's campaign did not provide any information to support Mulvaney's claim that Trump wouldn't be profiting from the G-7 summit.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Trump will not be profiting from the G-7 summit without providing concrete evidence or addressing the potential conflicts of interest raised by Trump's previous visits to his own resorts.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict suggests that Trump can expect to profit from future business generated at Doral as a result of hosting the G-7 summit. This alternative explanation challenges the claim that Trump will not be profiting from the event.
